body: I'm on it. I can reproduce the error in sftp, and it actually creates an empty directory instead of a file. Maybe that happens on the others as well?

It works correctly on local filesystem (Windows), as well as Jottacloud and Google Drive backends.

@alex-mahr you mention dropbox in the forum, can you confirm it is the same problem there? Can you share details for that too, like you did for ftp and sftp?

Sure, here it comes:

Dropbox error message:
```
2022/01/26 16:02:40 ERROR : Can't retry any of the errors - not attempting retries
2022/01/26 16:02:40 Failed to touch: path/malformed_path/...
```

And with "-vv":
```
2022/01/26 16:05:00 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.57.0" starting with parameters ["rclone" "--config" "/tmp/keyhelp/rclone-test-161f1631c5ed08" "--retries" "1" "-vv" "touch" "rclone-storage:/files/keyhelp-remote-storage-test-61f1631c5ede0"]
2022/01/26 16:05:00 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "rclone-storage:/files/keyhelp-remote-storage-test-61f1631c5ede0"
2022/01/26 16:05:00 DEBUG : Using config file from "/tmp/keyhelp/rclone-test-161f1631c5ed08"
2022/01/26 16:05:00 DEBUG : rclone-storage: Loaded invalid token from config file - ignoring
2022/01/26 16:05:00 DEBUG : Saving config "token" in section "rclone-storage" of the config file
2022/01/26 16:05:00 DEBUG : rclone-storage: Saved new token in config file
2022/01/26 16:05:00 DEBUG : Dropbox root '': Using root namespace "9158470304"
2022/01/26 16:05:01 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming cache item "rclone-storage:/files/keyhelp-remote-storage-test-61f1631c5ede0" to be canonical "rclone-storage:files/keyhelp-remote-storage-test-61f1631c5ede0"
2022/01/26 16:05:01 DEBUG : Touch time 2022-01-26 16:05:01.087469047 +0100 CET m=+0.694096977
2022/01/26 16:05:01 ERROR : Can't retry any of the errors - not attempting retries
2022/01/26 16:05:01 DEBUG : 4 go routines active
2022/01/26 16:05:01 Failed to touch: path/malformed_path/..
```

Config file looked like this:
```
[rclone-storage]
type = dropbox
token = {"access_token":"<secret-access-token>","token_type":"bearer","expires_in":14400,"refresh_token":"<secret-refresh-token>","scope":"account_info.read files.content.read files.cont>
client_id' = <client-id>
client_secret = <client-secret>
batch_mode = off
```

Result:
-> No file was created in Dropbox.


Meanwhile I have also tested with WebDAV. Surprisingly, touch worked without problems ;).
Also Dropbox works without problems with 1.56.2.

issue.title: touch: fix issue where directory is created instead of file

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

body:
I have a clear picture of the problem in ftp and sftp backends, and have a suggestion for fix in #5953. But it is specific for those two backends. I have no idea about the Dropbox issue. It seems to be something completely different. Do you @ncw see some clues? From the debug messages above it seems to end up here:

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/a667e03fc9ebc0e21f56e7a820bf873be987e034/cmd/touch/touch.go#L146

But the only error is the following, which I have no idea what is causing:

> 2022/01/26 16:05:01 ERROR : Can't retry any of the errors - not attempting retries

Wait, did @alex-mahr perhaps leave out some juicy parts at the end there? Following the "Failed to touch"..?

Edit: Forget it - I digged up an ancient Dropbox account and reproduced the issue - and found a fix! ðŸŽµ
@alex-mahr Should be fixed in latest [beta](https://beta.rclone.org/), if you want to try it out.
